front.title: Specifying transport mechanisms in Uniform Resource Identifiers

abstract.t: This document describes a simple extension of the Uniform ResourceIdentifier (URI) format that allows preferred transport mechanisms,including protocols, ports and interfaces, to be specified asparseable additions to the scheme name. This explicit configurationis beneficial for separation of the HyperText Transfer Protocol(HTTP) from underlying transports, which has been increasinglyrecognised as useful when a variety of ways of transporting orconfiguring use of HTTP are available and a choice of mechanism touse must be indicated.
